criteria: Accuracy in solving addition word problems
Accuracy in solving subtraction word problems
Use of objects or drawings to represent and solve problems
descriptions: No attempt or completely incorrect solutions to addition word problems.
Rarely solves addition word problems correctly; demonstrates little to no understanding of addition concepts.
Sometimes solves addition word problems correctly; shows some understanding of addition but makes frequent errors.
Generally solves addition word problems correctly; demonstrates a good understanding of addition concepts with occasional errors.
Consistently solves addition word problems correctly; demonstrates a strong understanding of addition concepts with minimal errors.
Masterfully solves addition word problems correctly and efficiently; demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of addition concepts and can apply them to novel situations.
No attempt or completely incorrect solutions to subtraction word problems.
Rarely solves subtraction word problems correctly; demonstrates little to no understanding of subtraction concepts.
Sometimes solves subtraction word problems correctly; shows some understanding of subtraction but makes frequent errors.
Generally solves subtraction word problems correctly; demonstrates a good understanding of subtraction concepts with occasional errors.
Consistently solves subtraction word problems correctly; demonstrates a strong understanding of subtraction concepts with minimal errors.
Masterfully solves subtraction word problems correctly and efficiently; demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of subtraction concepts and can apply them to novel situations.
Does not use objects or drawings, or the representations are irrelevant to the problem.
Attempts to use objects or drawings, but the representations are unclear, inaccurate, or do not aid in solving the problem.
Uses objects or drawings with limited effectiveness; representations are sometimes unclear or inaccurate.
Uses objects or drawings effectively to represent the problem, but the representations may lack detail or precision.
Uses clear and accurate objects or drawings to effectively represent and solve the problem; representations are well-organized and easy to understand.

Masterfully uses objects or drawings to represent and solve problems with exceptional clarity, precision, and insight; demonstrates a deep understanding of how representations can aid problem-solving.
